meanings.definition: Relating to the method used by Socrates to elicit knowledge from someone by a series of questions and answers.
meanings.sent1: The maieutic approach encouraged deep thinking through questioning.
meanings.sent2: Her maieutic teaching style helped students discover answers on their own.
meanings.sent3: The maieutic session turned into a fun game of back-and-forth questions.
meanings.sent4: His maieutic technique was like a gentle unraveling of hidden truths.
meanings.sent5: The maieutic process was like peeling layers of an onion to reveal the core.

meanings.definition: Characterized by open-ended questioning to stimulate critical thinking and self-discovery.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's maieutic approach sparked curiosity in the students.
meanings.sent2: They engaged in a maieutic discussion to explore different perspectives.
meanings.sent3: The maieutic inquiry led to unexpected and insightful revelations.
meanings.sent4: Her maieutic style of coaching was like guiding a journey of self-discovery.
meanings.sent5: The maieutic process was a path to unlocking one's own wisdom.
